C $Header: m:/default/input/RCS/rfinvest.txt,v 1.118 2020/07/06 15:57:27 ESH Exp $


Pulled from refine.f code, E85_Demand_Curve routine where all the below data are local variables


Year dollars for infrastructure cost
Variable:  Infrastructure_Year
@
2007

Year dollars for station cost
Variable:  Station_Cost_Year
@
2011

Variable:  INT_IC
@
0.08

Variable:  NYR_IC
@
   5

Variable:  INT_SC
@
0.10

Variable:  NYR_SC
@
  10

Variable:  Inc_Avail
@
0.0010

Variable:  Cost_per_station
@
150000.0

These (TRGNE85 and ETHNE85) are the same names as global variables, but they are local
Variable:  TRGNE85
@
0.26

Variable:  ETHNE85
@
0.74

This is an array.  Read the element and the value after we read how many rows to read
Variable:  Infrastructure_Cost
@
 9
 1     202.1
 2     180.0
 3     148.0
 4     148.0
 5     224.0
 6     194.8
 7     172.3
 8     242.8
 9     227.8

This is an array.  Read the element and the value after we read how many rows to read
Variable:  Total_Stations
@
 9
 1    7407.0
 2   15029.0
 3   20921.0
 4   16671.0
 5   36679.0
 6   17279.0
 7   27382.0
 8   10511.0
 9   15597.0


NEW DESIGN for E85 availability curve
 - shape of hockey stick around Qo
 - 10 steps to the left of Qo with flatter slope (elasticity)
 - 10 steps to the right of Qo with steep slope (elasticity)
 - Qo calculated in refine.f using TRAN's logit function
Elas = %change in Q / %change in P

FOR NEW curve DESIGN, set E85curveSwitch = 2
FOR original curve design, set E85curveSwitch = 1
E85curveSwitch:
@
 2

== BEGIN NEW DESIGN data ==

Elasticity for left (lower) curve
E85_Lower_ELAS
@
 0.600

Elasticity for right (upper) curve
E85_Upper_ELAS
@
 0.300

E85 to MG expected price ratio ($/MMBtu to $/MMBtu)
E85MGexpPrRatio
@
 1.200


This is an array.  Read the element and the value after we read how many rows to read
Represents the size of each step (on hockey stick supply curve, left of Qo) as a percent of Qo calculated in refine.f
Variable:  E85_Lower_Percents
@
10
01    0.30000
02    0.25000
03    0.15000
04    0.10000
05    0.08000
06    0.07000
07    0.03000
08    0.01000
09    0.00500
10    0.00500

This is an array.  Read the element and the value after we read how many rows to read
Represents the size of each step (on hockey stick supply curve, right of Qo) as a percent of Qo calculated in refine.f
Variable:  E85_Upper_Percents
@
10
11    0.10000
12    0.10000
13    0.10000
14    0.10000
15    0.10000
16    0.10000
17    0.10000
18    0.10000
19    0.10000
20    0.10000

This is an array.  Read the element and the value after we read how many rows to read
Variable:  E85AVAIL_Growth
@
 9
 1     0.0200000
 2     0.0200000
 3     0.0200000
 4     0.0200000
 5     0.0200000
 6     0.0200000
 7     0.0200000
 8     0.0200000
 9     0.0200000

== END NEW DESIGN data ==

== BEGIN orignal E85 curve DESIGN data ==

@
 3

@
0.10
